properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 4:17AM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...LIGHT SNOW EXPECTED MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...
SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM LIKELY LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY...

.Snow levels hold around 2500 to 3000 ft this morning before
rising slightly this afternoon. As a result, several local
highway summits will see additional light snow accumulations this
morning as showers pass overhead. Shower activity quickly weakens
this afternoon.

A more significant winter storm is expected to impact the region
late Wednesday afternoon through Thursday, with widespread heavy
mountain snow accumulations likely. Snow levels are expected to
fall from 3000 to nearly 2000 feet early Thursday morning, which
will bring heavy snow accumulations to numerous interior mountain
highways, including Highways 299, 36, 3, and potentially 199, in
addition to numerous rural roadways. In addition, accumulating
small hail will be possible in coastal low elevations late
Wednesday night and Thursday. Travel will likely become dangerous
or even temporarily impossible in some high elevation areas, so
please prepare now.

* WHAT...This morning, additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches above 2500 feet. Late Wednesday through Thursday
widespread heavy snow is likely. 4 to 8 inches are possible
between 2000 and 3000 feet, with totals greater than one foot
possible above 3000 feet, and multiple feet possible in the
Trinity Alps. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST this
morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon
through Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible,
particularly Wednesday night and Thursday. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON
